cz.syntea.xdef.xml

Class KXmlUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.syntea.xdef.xml.KDOMUtils
      • cz.syntea.xdef.xml.KXmlUtils

  • public final class KXmlUtils
extends KDOMUtils
    Collection of static methods designed for easy work with XML data. KDOMBuilder is used for creation of XML objects and it is set in the class initialization time.

        public static final org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument()
        Creates an XML Document object with created document builder (see SetDOMImplementation).
        Returns:

      • newDocument

        public static final org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument(java.lang.String nsURI,
                                                     java.lang.String qname,
                                                     org.w3c.dom.DocumentType docType)
        Creates an XML Document object with empty root element created by document builder (see SetDOMImplementation).
        Parameters:
        nsURI - namespace of created root element (or null).
        qname - qualified name of root element.
        docType - DocumentType object or null.
        Returns:
        new Document object with empty root element.

      • getDOMImplementation

        public static final org.w3c.dom.DOMImplementation getDOMImplementation()
        The DOMImplementation object that handles this document. A DOM application may use objects from multiple implementations.
        Returns:
        The DOMImplementation object.

      • setAllNSToNull

        public static final void setAllNSToNull(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Removes all namespaces and namespace prefixes from document and its attributes and all child nodes. If an attribute with the local name already exists the it is not replaced.
        Parameters:
        doc - document where all prefixes and namespaces of child child nodes are removed.

      • setAllNSToNull

        public static final org.w3c.dom.Element setAllNSToNull(org.w3c.dom.Element elem)
        Removes all namespaces and namespace prefixes from element and its attributes and all child nodes. If an attribute with the local name already exists then it is left unchanged. All xmlns attributes are removed.
        Parameters:
        elem - element if scope of which all prefixes and namespaces are removed.
        Returns:
        element without namespaces and namespace prefixes. If nothing was changed then the original element is returned.

      • toXmlText

        public static final java.lang.String toXmlText(java.lang.String value,
                                               char delimiter,
                                               boolean ignoreWhiteSpaces)
        Returns a string in the XML format. All occurrences of special characters are replaced with entity references <>&"'. If the argument ignoreWhiteSpaces is true then all ignorable white spaces are removed. If the argument delimiter is < then the result string is created for a text node, otherwise it will be created as a value of attribute and delimiter occurrence will be transformed to the appropriate predefined entity. Note that the argument shouldn't contain an entity reference or character reference.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - attributes: '"' or "'", text nodes: '<'.
        ignoreWhiteSpaces - If true all ignorable white spaces are removed.
        value - The original string.
        Returns:
        The string in canonical form.

      • writeXml

        public static final void writeXml(java.io.Writer out,
                                  java.lang.String encoding,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                  java.lang.String indentStep,
                                  boolean canonical,
                                  boolean removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces,
                                  boolean comments)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Write node to output stream. Result will be indented if the argument indentStep is a string with indenting spaces. If argument indentStep is null then output is not indented. If argument canonical is true the output is in canonical form (i.e. without entity references, CDATA sections are converted to text values). If argument comments is false all Comment nodes are ignored.
        Parameters:
        out - output writer used for result.
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted.
        encoding - name of output code table.
        indentStep - null or the indenting string.
        canonical - if true the output is canonical form.
        removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces - if true white space sequence is replaced by one space.
        comments - if true comments are generated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs.

      • writeXml

        public static final void writeXml(java.io.OutputStreamWriter out,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Node node)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Write node as XML to output stream. The character set encoding is set from the outputStreamWriter.
        Parameters:
        out - output writer used for result.
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs.

      • writeXml

        public static final void writeXml(java.io.OutputStreamWriter out,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                  boolean indenting,
                                  boolean removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces,
                                  boolean comments)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Write node in XML format.
        Parameters:
        out - output writer used for result.
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted.
        indenting - if true the output will be indented.
        removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces - if true white space sequence is replaced by one space.
        comments - if true comment nodes are written to output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if on I/O error occurs.

                           throws java.io.IOException
        Write node in XML format.
        Parameters:
        fname - output file name.
        encoding - character set name.
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted.
        indenting - if true the output will be indented.
        comments - if true comment nodes are written to output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • nodeToString

        public static final java.lang.String nodeToString(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                  boolean comments,
                                                  boolean removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces,
                                                  boolean indent)
        Create string in XML format from given argument. Output format may be either unindented (and without inserted new lines) or in the intended form.
        Parameters:
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted.
        indent - If this parameter is set to true the output string is in indented format, otherwise in no indentation is generated.
        removeIgnorableWhiteSpaces - if true white space sequence is replaced by one space.
        comments - if true comment nodes are written to output.
        Returns:
        string with the XML representation of the parameter element.

      • nodeToString

        public static final java.lang.String nodeToString(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                  boolean indent)
        Create string in XML format from given argument. The output format may be either unindented (without inserted new lines) or in the intended form.
        Parameters:
        node - org.w3c.dom.Node to be converted to the string.
        indent - If this parameter is set to true the output string is in indented format, otherwise in no indentation is generated.
        Returns:
        string with the XML representation of the parameter element.

      • nodeToString

        public static final java.lang.String nodeToString(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Create string in XML format from given node. The output format is not indented.
        Parameters:
        node - node to be converted to the string.
        Returns:
        string with the XML representation of the parameter element.

      • parseXml

        public static final org.w3c.dom.Document parseXml(java.lang.String source)
        Parse source file or a string with XMLke format and create org.w3c.dom.Document (i.e. it starts with <).
        Parameters:
        source - can be the path to a file or a string in XML format.
        Returns:
        parsed document.
        Throws:
        SRuntimeException - if an error occurs.

      • parseXml

                                                  boolean comments)
        Parse source file or a string with XMLke format and create org.w3c.dom.Document (i.e. it starts with <).
        Parameters:
        source - can be the path to a file or a string in XML format.
        comments - if true comment nodes are written to result document.
        Returns:
        parsed document.
        Throws:
        SRuntimeException - if an error occurs.

                                                  boolean closeStream)
        Parse source file with XML and return org.w3c.dom.Document.

        closeStream - if true the input stream is closed after parsing.

      • appendChild

        public static final void appendChild(org.w3c.dom.Element what,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Element where)
        Append an element from the argument what at the child list of the element from argument where. If the owner of both elements are different create new copy of the element what in the document owner of the element where.
        Parameters:
        what - element to be appended.
        where - element where the element will be appended.

      • compareXML

        public static final ReportWriter compareXML(java.io.File xml_A,
                                            java.io.File xml_B)
        Compare XML documents. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        xml_A - file with first document.
        xml_B - file with second document.
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.

      • compareXML

        public static final ReportWriter compareXML(java.lang.String xml_A,
                                            java.lang.String xml_B)
        Compare XML documents. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        xml_A - first document (or element).
        xml_B - second document (or element).
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.

      • compareXML

        public static final ReportWriter compareXML(java.lang.String xml_A,
                                            java.lang.String xml_B,
                                            boolean trimText)
        Compare XML documents. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        xml_A - first document (or element).
        xml_B - second document (or element).
        trimText - if true then all text values are rimmed before comparing.
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.

      • compareXML

        public static final ReportWriter compareXML(java.lang.String xml_A,
                                            java.lang.String xml_B,
                                            boolean trimText,
                                            ReportWriter reporter)
        Compare XML documents. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        xml_A - first document (or element).
        xml_B - second document (or element).
        trimText - if true then text values are trimmed before comparing.
        reporter - report writer or null (the ArrayReporter will be created).
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.

      • compareElements

        public static final ReportWriter compareElements(org.w3c.dom.Element elem_A,
                                                 org.w3c.dom.Element elem_B)
        Compare XML elements. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        elem_A - first element.
        elem_B - second element.
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.

      • compareElements

        public static final ReportWriter compareElements(org.w3c.dom.Element elem_A,
                                                 org.w3c.dom.Element elem_B,
                                                 boolean trimText,
                                                 ReportWriter reporter)
        Compare XML elements. If the method errors() on the resulting reporter gives false no differences were recognized.
        Parameters:
        elem_A - first element.
        elem_B - second element.
        trimText - if true then text values are trimmed before comparing.
        reporter - report writer or null (the ArrayReporter will be created).
        Returns:
        report writer with results of comparing.
